IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: STARR COMMONWEALTH'S MISSION IS TO CREATE POSITIVE ENVIRONMENTS WHERE CHILDREN FLOURISH. A FULL CONTINUUM OF COMMUNITY-BASED, FAMILY PRESERVATION, EARLY INTERVENTION, AND SPECIALIZED RESIDENTIAL PROGRAMS ARE OFFERED IN MICHIGAN. EDUCATION AND TRAINING PROGRAMS ARE OFFERED FOR CHILDCARE PROFESSIONALS, CLINICIANS, EDUCATORS, AND PARENTS. ALL PROGRAMS AND SERVICES ARE ROOTED IN THE BELIEF THAT EVERY CHILD HAS STRENGTHS. TREATMENT SERVICES ENABLE EACH YOUNG PERSON TO IDENTIFY AND CULTIVATE THEIR STRENGTHS IN WAYS THAT ENABLE THEM TO ACHIEVE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL.
IRS990.MissionDesc: STARR COMMONWEALTH'S MISSION IS TO CREATE POSITIVE ENVIRONMENTS WHERE CHILDREN FLOURISH. A FULL CONTINUUM OF COMMUNITY-BASED, FAMILY PRESERVATION, EARLY INTERVENTION, AND SPECIALIZED RESIDENTIAL PROGRAMS ARE OFFERED IN MICHIGAN. EDUCATION AND TRAINING PROGRAMS ARE OFFERED FOR CHILDCARE PROFESSIONALS, CLINICIANS, EDUCATORS, AND PARENTS. ALL PROGRAMS AND SERVICES ARE ROOTED IN THE BELIEF THAT EVERY CHILD HAS STRENGTHS. TREATMENT SERVICES ENABLE EACH YOUNG PERSON TO IDENTIFY AND CULTIVATE THEIR STRENGTHS IN WAYS THAT ENABLE THEM TO ACHIEVE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL.
IRS990.Desc: RESIDENTIAL SERVICESDURING THE 2018 FISCAL YEAR, 296 YOUTH WERE SERVED IN OUR SPECIALIZED RESIDENTIAL TREATMENT PROGRAMS. OUR TREATMENT SERVICES ADDRESSED BEHAVIORAL ISSUES SUCH AS JUVENILE DELINQUENCY, SEX OFFENSES, SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES. THIS YEAR, WE EXPANDED OUR ABUSE AND NEGLECT SERVICES FOR GIRLS AND BEGAN WORKING WITH A CHARTER SCHOOL ON OUR RESIDENTIAL CAMPUS ALLOWING STUDENTS TO EARN A HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA WHILE IN OUR CARE. THE AVERAGE LENGTH OF STAY FOR YOUTH RECEIVING RESIDENTIAL SERVICES IS 9.7 MONTHS. 74% WERE RELEASED TO FAMILY OR ANOTHER COMMUNITY SETTING.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: COMMUNITY-BASEDDURING THE 2018 FISCAL YEAR, 170 YOUTH WERE SERVED IN OUR COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES. OUR PROGRAMS INCLUDED A DELINQUENCY DIVERSION PROGRAM AND AN INTENSIVE IN-HOME TREATMENT PROGRAM. THE INTENSIVE IN-HOME PROGRAM UTILIZED PLAY THERAPY, INDIVIDUAL AND FAMILY THERAPY COVERING TOPICS SUCH AS PSYCHOEDUCATION, PARENTING, SELF-ESTEEM, PREVENTION OF SELF-HARM, ANGER MANAGEMENT, RELAXATION, COMMUNICATION, FAMILY DYNAMICS AND APPROPRIATE BEHAVIOR. THE DIVERSION PROGRAM INCLUDES TUTORING AND MENTORING, GROUP AND INDIVIDUAL THERAPY COVERING TOPICS SUCH AS SCHOOL BEHAVIOR, MAKING GOOD CHOICES, SUBSTANCE ABUSE, HEALTH, CONSENT, FRIENDSHIPS, JOB SEEKING, CAREER AND FUTURE GOALS, FAMILY RELATIONSHIPS, COMMUNITY SERVICE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: PROFESSIONAL TRAINING AND COACHINGDURING THE 2018 FISCAL YEAR, 5,998 PROFESSIONALS RECEIVED TRAINING ON THE TOPICS OF HUMAN TRAUMA, POSITIVE YOUTH DEVELOPMENT, BUILDING RESILIENCE, MINDFULNESS, SELF-CARE, SUICIDE PREVENTION, RACIAL HEALING, CHILDHOOD SEXUAL BEHAVIOR AND ADHD THROUGH E-COURSES AND TRAINING EVENTS ACROSS THE UNITED STATES AND CANADA. 282 TRAINING EVENTS WERE OFFERED AND ATTENDED. IN ADDITION TO TRAINING, 32 EVENTS OF CONSULTING AND COACHING WERE DELIVERED FOR ORGANIZATIONS AND SCHOOLS. FOR ALL EVENTS, THE RANGE OF SATISFACTION ON A 5 POINT SCALE WAS 4.0-4.7 THAT THE MATERIAL WAS RELEVANT AND WILL BE USED IN THEIR OWN PROFESSIONAL SETTING.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: SEQUEL YOUTH SERVICES OF ALBION LLC

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: MISCELLANEOUS INCOME - 2013 AMOUNT: $ 62,171. 2014 AMOUNT: $ 170,936. 2015 AMOUNT: $ -89,032. 2016 AMOUNT: $ 87,192. 2017 AMOUNT: $ -39,958. FUNDRAISING EVENT REVENUE - 2017 AMOUNT: $ 11,773.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ARTWORK HELD BY STARR IS USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES FOR THE STUDENTS.

STARR'S ENDOWMENT APPROPRIATES EARNINGS FOR USE IN CURRENT OPERATIONS. USING THE AVERAGE FAIR VALUE OF ENDOWED ASSETS OVER THE PRIOR 12 QUARTERS, A SPENDING RATE FORMULA DETERMINES THE AMOUNT. FOR FISCAL YEAR 2017-18, 5.2% OF THE 12 QUARTER AVERAGE OF ASSETS WAS APPROPRIATED TO OPERATIONS.
INVESTMENT FEES NETTED WITH REVENUE ON FS -211,448. OTHER EXPENSES NETTED WITH REVENUE ON FS -8,631. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 7,963. RELATED ORGANIZATION REVENUES 5,443. FACILITIES MANAGEMENT FEE 51,338.
ANNUITY PAYMENTS INCLUDED WITH CHANGE IN FAIR VALUE OF ANNUITIES ON FS -98,960. COST OF GOODS SOLD -155,590.

RELATED ORGANIZATION EXPENSES 337,363. INVESTMENT FEES NETTED WITH REVENUE ON FS -211,448. OTHER EXPENSES NETTED WITH REVENUE ON FS -8,631. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 7,963. FACILITIES MANAGEMENT FEE 51,338. COST OF GOODS SOLD 155,590.
THE RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IS EMBODIED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S STATEMENT OF CORE VALUES THAT ARE PRINTED FREQUENTLY IN BROCHURES, NEWSLETTERS, AND ON THE WEBSITE WWW.STARR.ORG.
THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVED A FEDERAL GRANT FROM THE NATIONAL SCHOOL LUNCH PROGRAM.
THE ORGANIZATION KEEPS A SCHEDULE OF ALL EXPENSES AGAINST THE GRANTS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GIVEN BASED ON NEED THROUGH A FORMAL PROCESS FOR AWARDING SCHOLARSHIPS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: STARR COMMONWEALTH ENTERED INTO A PURCHASE-OF-SERVICES AGREEMENT WITH AN UNRELATED OUTSIDE COMPANY TO MANAGE AND OPERATE THE ALBION, MICHIGAN RESIDENTIAL PROGRAMS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: STARR COMMONWEALTH AMENDED ITS BYLAWS DURING FISCAL YEAR 2018 TO INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING CHANGES: 1. REMOVE THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AS A STANDING COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD 2. ADJUST THE BOARD COMPOSITION 3. CHANGE THE NUMBER OF VOTING BOARD MEMBERS 4. ADD A TREASURER OFFICER POSITION TO THE BOARD 5. AMEND THE VOTING APPROVAL REQUIREMENTS OF THE GOVERNING BODY SO THAT ACTION CAN BE TAKEN WITHOUT A MEETING PROVIDED THAT BEFORE OR AFTER THE ACTION, ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OR OF THE COMMITTEE CONSENT TO THE ACTION IN WRITING OR BY ELECTRONIC TRANSMISSION

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DRAFT COPY OF THIS FORM 990 WAS REVIEWED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S CEO AND CFO. IT WAS ALSO REVIEWED BY THE BOARD'S AUDIT COMMITTEE. ALL BOARD MEMBERS RECEIVED NOTICE THAT THE DRAFT COPY WAS AVAILABLE FOR THEIR REVIEW ON THE STARR COMMONWEALTH WEBSITE. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REPORTS THE RESULTS OF ITS REVIEW TO THE BOARD. THE FINAL FORM 990 WAS MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS ON THE WEBSITE ALONG WITH NOTICE OF THE DATE THE RETURN WOULD BE FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: STARR COMMONWEALTH HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROTECTING STARR'S INTEREST WHEN IT IS CONSIDERING ENTERING INTO A TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT THAT MIGHT BENEFIT THE PRIVATE INTEREST OF A TRUSTEE OR OFFICER OR MIGHT RESULT IN A POSSIBLE EXCESS BENEFIT TRANSACTION. THE ORGANIZATION'S FIRST STEP IN MONITORING IS TO REGULARLY INFORM KEY STAFF AND BOARD MEMBERS THAT STARR SEEKS TO AVOID REAL AND APPARENT CONFLICTS BY NOT ENGAGING IN TRANSACTIONS WITH THEM OR MEMBERS OF THEIR FAMILY. WHEN CIRCUMSTANCES DO ARISE THROUGH THE ANNUAL DISCLOSURE REQUIREMENTS OR OTHERWISE, THE MATTER IS REVIEWED BY THE CEO AND WHEN APPROPRIATE, BY A REPRESENTATIVE BODY OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. DETERMINATION OF WHETHER A CONFLICT DOES IN FACT EXIST AND THE RESOLUTION OF IT IS ACCOMPLISHED UNDER THE GUIDELINES PROVIDED IN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A SUB COMMITTEE OF INDEPENDENT BOARD MEMBERS REVIEWS THE PRESIDENT/CEO COMPENSATION. THE COMPENSATION IS ESTABLISHED BASED PRINCIPALLY UPON REVIEW OF INDEPENDENT SURVEYS OF NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND COMPARISON WITH RELEVANT INDUSTRY PEER ORGANIZATIONS. THE PRESIDENT/CEO DETERMINES COMPENSATION OF OTHER OFFICERS THROUGH REVIEW OF INDEPENDENT SURVEYS OF NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND COMPARISON WITH RELEVANT INDUSTRY PEER ORGANIZATIONS. DECISIONS REGARDING COMPENSATION WILL BE DOCUMENTED IN THE BOARD MINUTES. THE REVIEW WAS MOST RECENTLY UNDERTAKEN IN FISCAL YEAR ENDED 2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: STARR HAS OPERATED AS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION SINCE ITS FOUNDING IN 1913 AND WAS GRANTED TAX EXEMPT STATUS PRIOR TO JULY 15, 1987. HOWEVER, IT DOES NOT HAVE A COPY OF FORM 1023 OR OTHER DOCUMENTS THAT MAY HAVE BEEN USED TO APPLY FOR TAX-EXEMPT STATUS. STARR COMMONWEALTH'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF INTERESTS IN PERPETUAL AND REMAINDER TRUSTS 64,802. UNREALIZED ACTUARIAL ADJUSTMENT 20,994.
THERE HAS BEEN NO CHANGE IN OVERSIGHT PROCESS FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
